intro: Melanium, commonly known as the bluebell, is a flowering plant belonging to the Amaryllidaceae family. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features strap-like, grassy leaves. Melanium is native to southern Europe and is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological importance.
